title: Practice Exercise
description:
Build a **Ride Safety Checker** for an amusement park that determines if someone can ride different attractions. **Ride Requirements:** - **Roller Coaster**: Height >= 48 inches AND not pregnant - **Bumper Cars**: Age >= 5 OR (age >= 3 AND with adult) - **Ferris Wheel**: No restrictions (everyone can ride) **Your task:** - Ask for height (inches), age, pregnancy status, and if accompanied by adult - Use logical operators to check eligibility for each ride - Display which rides they can access **Example output:** 
=== Amusement Park Ride Checker ===

Enter your height (inches): 50
Enter your age: 7
Are you pregnant? (yes/no): no
Are you with an adult? (yes/no): no

Ride Access:
✓ Roller Coaster: True
✓ Bumper Cars: True  
✓ Ferris Wheel: True

You can ride 3 out of 3 attractions!

hints.text: For the roller coaster, use: height >= 48 and not is_pregnant. For bumper cars, use parentheses to group the age check with adult: age >= 5 or (age >= 3 and with_adult). Remember that 'and' requires ALL conditions to be True, while 'or' needs at least ONE to be True.

commonMistakes.correction: Add : at the end of the line
